headline: White House moves to oust Dr. Oz and Herschel Walker from presidential advisory panel
author: Zoë Richards
sentences: Oz, the celebrity doctor, and Walker, the former football star, were each sent a letter Wednesday asking them to resign from the President’s Council on Sports, Fitness & Nutrition by the end of the day, warning that failure to step down would result in termination, a White House official said.

The Biden administration threatened Wednesday to remove Dr. Mehmet Oz and Herschel Walker from a federal advisory committee if they didn't resign, setting the stage for a public fight with two high-profile GOP Senate candidates.

Earlier Wednesday, the White House announced plans to name the chef José Andrés and the WNBA player Elena Delle Donne as co-chairs of the presidential council, of which Walker has been the chair and Oz has been a member.
In September, former White House press secretary Sean Spicer and former White House budget director Russ Vought were asked to resign from their positions on advisory boards.
